Name: Requiring autism spectrum disorder reporting.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to autism spectrum disorder reporting
BodyName: Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
This Introduction was Re-referred to Committee by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services

This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
History.MinutesNote: This bill was returned unsigned on Wed. Oct. 11, 2017 (31st Day, Sun. Oct. 8, 2017).

History.Description: This Introduction was Recved from Mayor by Council

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to collect data on the incidence of autism spectrum disorder diagnoses in New York City, by community district, and to post this data on its website.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
 
      Section 1. The administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 17-199.6 to read as follows:
      � 17-199.6 Report of autism spectrum disorder services. a. No later than April 1 of each year, the department shall submit to the mayor and the speaker of the city council and post on its website, the number of individuals receiving services for autism spectrum disorders from the department or programs administered by the department, disaggregated by zip code.
      b. Information required to be reported pursuant to this section shall be reported in a manner that does not violate any applicable provision of federal, state or local law relating to the privacy of information. Any category required to be reported that contains between 1 and 9 individuals, or allows another category to be narrowed to between 1 and 9 individuals, shall be reported with a symbol.
      � 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
      
      
      
DSS/NKA
LS 8338
8/23/2017
